Class LottoBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • LottoBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Eurojackpot, Lotto, Zusatzziehung

    public class LottoBase
extends java.lang.Object
    The class LottoBase is to generate numbers from 1 to a given number. This class is inherited in the classes "Eurojackpot" and "Lotto".
    Author:
    Julian Vornfeld

      java.util.logging.Logger Log

    • Field Detail

      • UnluckyNumbers

        public int[] UnluckyNumbers
        An int array with variable length. In that array are all unlucky numbers, who shout be ignored in GetNumbers().

      • Log

        public java.util.logging.Logger Log

    • Constructor Detail

      • LottoBase

        public LottoBase(int MaxNr,
                 int[] UnluckyNumbers,
                 java.util.logging.Logger Log)

    • Method Detail

      • CheckValidity

        public int CheckValidity(int Number)
        This method checks if the number in the parameter is higher then the variable MaxNr (specified in the constructor).
        Parameters:
        A - number of the UnluckyNumbers array.
        Returns:
        Returns zero, if the given number is higher than MaxNr (specified in the constructor).

      • CheckValidity

        public boolean CheckValidity(int[] Numbers,
                             int NewNumber)
        This method checks: 1. Is the input number (NewNumber) already in the input array (Numbers). 2. Is the input number (NewNumber) a number of the UnluckyNumbers array. If that's the case, "False" is the output.
        Parameters:
        A - number (NewNumber) which should be checked and an array to check with.
        Returns:
        Returns "false" if the numbers is in the input or the UnluckyNumbers array

      • GetNumbers

        public int[] GetNumbers(int Drawings)
        This method outputs an int array with a given number of random numbers. The number of random numbers, is specified in the input parameter "Drawings". The Range is 1 to MaxNr (specified in the constructor).
        Parameters:
        The - number of random numbers in the array.
        Returns:
        Returns an int array with a given number of random numbers.
